scenarios.name: E2E Pair-Wise Verification for a Single User Pair
scenarios.description: This end-to-end test verifies the complete collaborative workflow for a single pair of users from an Excel file. User1 logs in, creates a task and a top priority, and logs out. User2 then logs in, verifies User1's data, creates their own task and priority, and logs out. Finally, User1 re-logs in to verify User2's data, confirming bi-directional data synchronization.
user_journey: PHASE 1: First User Login and Setup (User1)
Step 1: Navigate to the application URL and verify the login page is displayed.
Step 2: Enter User1's email from Excel and click Continue.
Step 3: Enter User1's password from Excel and click Login.
Step 4: Select the correct Company_Name from Excel.
Step 5: Click the Huddles menu to expand the dropdown.
Step 6: Select the correct huddleName from Excel.
Step 7: Click 'Add Task' button and enter User1's TaskName from Excel.
Step 8: Click the calendar icon and select the DueDate from Excel.
Step 9: Click the Save button and wait for the task to be saved.
Step 10: Locate the 'Top Priority' input field in the 'My Updates' section.
Step 11: Enter User1's TopPriority text from Excel into the field.
Step 12: Click outside the field to trigger the auto-save.
Step 13: Click the profile menu, select Sign Out, and wait for the login page.
PHASE 2: Second User Login and Verification (User2)
Step 14: Repeat login steps 1-6 for User2 using their credentials from Excel.
Step 15: Verify User2 appears at the top of the members list.
Step 16: Click on User1 in the members panel to view their updates.
Step 17: Verify User1's TaskName is displayed in the 'Who What When' section.
Step 18: Verify User1's TopPriority is displayed in the 'My Updates' section.
Step 19: Click on User2 in the members panel to return to their own view.
Step 20: Confirm the 'My Updates' section is visible for the current user.
Step 21: Repeat task creation steps 7-9 using User2's data from Excel.
Step 22: Repeat priority creation steps 10-12 using User2's data from Excel.
Step 23: Click the profile menu and Sign Out.
PHASE 3: First User Re-login and Cross-Verification (User1)
Step 24: Repeat login steps 1-6 for User1.
Step 25: Click on User2 in the members panel.
Step 26: Verify User2's TaskName is visible in the 'Who What When' section.
Step 27: Verify User2's TopPriority is visible in the 'My Updates' section.
Step 28: Click the profile menu and Sign Out.
acceptance_criteria: User1 successfully logs in, creates a task and priority, and logs out.
User2 successfully logs in and can view User1's task and priority as specified in the Excel file.
User2 successfully creates their own task and priority using data from the Excel file.
User1 can successfully re-login and view User2's newly created task and priority.
All data synchronization occurs successfully and is visible to the corresponding user in the pair.
test_data_requirements: A valid user pair (e.g., sample_user_pair_1) from the Excel file with matching Company_Name and huddleName.
Users must have permissions to create tasks and add priorities.

scenarios.name: Successful Task Creation and Cross-User Visibility
scenarios.description: This scenario focuses specifically on the task creation and verification part of the workflow. It ensures that a task created by one user is correctly saved and becomes immediately visible to another user in the same huddle.
user_journey: Step 1: User1 logs in, selects the company, and navigates to the specified huddle.
Step 2: User1 clicks the 'Add Task' button.
Step 3: User1 enters the TaskName from the Excel file.
Step 4: User1 clicks the calendar icon and selects the DueDate from the Excel file.
Step 5: User1 clicks the 'Save' button and confirms the task appears.
Step 6: User1 logs out.
Step 7: User2 logs in, selects the same company, and navigates to the same huddle.
Step 8: User2 clicks on User1 in the members panel.
Step 9: User2 scrolls to the 'Who What When' section.
acceptance_criteria: User1's task is successfully created and saved with the correct name and due date.
After User2 logs in, User1's task is visible and accurately displayed in the 'Who What When' section of User1's profile view.
test_data_requirements: A valid user pair from the Excel file with data for Email, Password, Company_Name, huddleName, TaskName, and DueDate.

scenarios.name: Successful Priority Creation and Cross-User Visibility
scenarios.description: This scenario focuses on the priority creation workflow, specifically testing the interaction with the contenteditable div. It verifies that a priority set by one user is correctly auto-saved and is visible to their huddle partner.
user_journey: Step 1: User1 logs in, selects the company, and navigates to the specified huddle.
Step 2: User1 scrolls to the 'My Updates' section.
Step 3: User1 clicks on the 'Top Priority' field to focus on it.
Step 4: User1 enters the TopPriority text from the Excel file.
Step 5: User1 clicks another element on the page to shift focus and trigger the auto-save.
Step 6: User1 logs out.
Step 7: User2 logs in, selects the same company, and navigates to the same huddle.
Step 8: User2 clicks on User1 in the members panel.
Step 9: User2 scrolls to the 'My Updates' section.
acceptance_criteria: User1's top priority text is successfully entered and saved via the auto-save mechanism.
After User2 logs in, User1's top priority is visible and accurately displayed in the 'My Updates' section of User1's profile view.
test_data_requirements: A valid user pair from the Excel file with data for Email, Password, Company_Name, huddleName, and TopPriority.

scenarios.name: Data-Driven E2E Workflow for a Second User Pair
scenarios.description: This scenario validates the data-driven capability of the test suite by executing the full pair-wise E2E workflow for a second, distinct pair of users (User3 and User4) from the Excel file. This ensures the test logic correctly iterates through the data source.
user_journey: The test automation reads the second pair of user data (e.g., User3 and User4) from the Excel file.
Execute the complete 28-step E2E workflow as defined in scenario TS001, but using the data for User3 and User4.
PHASE 1: User3 logs in, creates their task and priority, and logs out.
PHASE 2: User4 logs in, verifies User3's data, creates their own task and priority, and logs out.
PHASE 3: User3 re-logs in and verifies User4's data.
acceptance_criteria: The test successfully processes the second pair of users from the Excel sheet.
User3's created task and priority are visible to User4.
User4's created task and priority are visible to User3 upon re-login.
The test completes the full cycle for the second pair without errors.
test_data_requirements: An Excel file containing at least two valid user pairs, such as sample_user_pair_1 and sample_user_pair_2.
Each pair must have a matching Company_Name and huddleName.

scenarios.name: Successful UI Navigation from Login to Huddle
scenarios.description: This scenario verifies the fundamental navigation flow of the application. It ensures a user can successfully authenticate, be presented with a company selection, and navigate to their designated huddle based on the data provided in the Excel file.
user_journey: Step 1: Navigate to the application URL.
Step 2: Enter a valid user email from Excel and click Continue.
Step 3: Enter the corresponding password from Excel and click Login.
Step 4: On the company selection page, locate and click the company name specified in the Excel file.
Step 5: In the main navigation, locate and click the 'Huddles' menu to expand it.
Step 6: From the dropdown, click the huddle name specified in the Excel file.
acceptance_criteria: The user is correctly redirected to the company selection page.
The specified company is successfully selected.
The user successfully navigates to and lands on the correct huddle page.
test_data_requirements: A single valid user record from the Excel file containing Email, Password, Company_Name, and huddleName.

dependencies: A properly formatted Excel file (.xlsx) with all required headers must exist and be accessible to the test runner.
All users in the test data must be pre-provisioned in the application with the correct permissions to access the specified companies and huddles.
Each pair of users designated for a test run must be members of the same company and the same huddle.
The application environment must be stable and accessible at the specified base_url.
The test automation framework must be configured to handle session management correctly, ensuring cookies are cleared after each user's logout.
edge_cases: Successfully creating a task with a due date far in the future.
Successfully setting a Top Priority that contains special characters and is very long.
Successfully completing the workflow where the huddleName or TaskName contains leading/trailing spaces which are handled correctly by the application.
Successfully completing the workflow on the last day of a month or year using the calendar picker.
